events.name: SEA Makerthon 2016: Singapore
events.description:
Does FOOD WASTAGE in Singapore frustrate you? What if YOU could solve Singapore's food waste issue? Join Singapore's first hackathon addressing zero-waste and stand to WIN up to $500.

Here in Singapore, we dispose 681,400 tonnes of food yearly and only recycle 13% of it. Now that's a real problem. We're partnering with food solutions provider Sodexo and cleantech solutions provider Enerprof to address this challenge of reducing food waste from the moment food is purchased to the time it goes to the trash.

Don't know how to go about innovating? Don't worry! We'll be conducting masterclasses on relevant technologies such as Computer Vision, Machine Learning, App Development and Internet of Things devices. 

That's not all! You stand a chance to win $500 in cash, mentorship and the chance to represent Singapore at the regional competition this October where you will be competing with 9 other cities across Southeast Asia!

Find out more at:
 http://seamakerspace.net/sea-makerthon-singapore/
Sign  up today!: http://goo.gl/q1DJDY
_________________________________________________
Singapore PRE MAKERTHON WORKSHOP

In this workshop, we will be giving a brief overview on the makerthon that will be happening on the 24&25th of September. We will also be teaching the software Autodesk Fusion 360 to as an introduction to 3D modeling.

Date: 17 September 2016 
Time: 2pm to 4pm
Venue: Community Lab@United World College SEA East Campus(Tampines) 
Sign Up: To sign up, please buy a ticket below!
*Please bring your laptop and a mouse for this session

________________________________________________

SEA Makerthon 2016:Singapore 
Dates: 24 &25 September (Saturday and Sunday)
Venue: Community Lab@UWCSEA Tampines
Participant Fee: $15 (for meals)
Min Age: 15
Team Size: 2-4 People Per Team

events.name: workshop 4 [Beginner]
events.description: Hey everyone, we'll be having a 4 weeks workshop (every Saturday) on the basics of web programming that covers HTML, CSS, PHP and Javascript. This programming workshop is meant for beginners who have zero experience and touch with any programming languages at all, and is interested to learn more about the web. Not only will you learn coding skills, you'll also learn essential programming concepts that will help build your core fundamentals and help you become a great programmer. Throughout the workshop lessons, you'll learn to build an eCommerce website and by the end of it, you'll have a fully fledged eCommerce site deployed on the web. All the workshops are free of charge (gratis) and will be recorded. Feel free to stay after the workshop and ask us technical questions regarding any projects you have. For the second lesson, we will be covering: • Javascript Part 2 • Deployment Light refreshments and snacks will be provided. Timing 11AM to 4PM Venue Ngee Ann Polytechnic, LT 73C. Things To Bring • Laptop • Laptop Charger • Github Account (github.com) • Codeanywhere Account (Codeanywhere.com)
events.location: Ngee Ann Polytechnic, 535 Clementi Road, Singapore 599489

events.name: Do Good: A Social Entrepreneurship Panel
events.description:
RSVP for free here: http://mis-dogood.peatix.com

Speakers:

Ashwin Subramaniam (Co-founder, Gone Adventurin')
Seng Choon Koh (Executive Director, Project Dignity)
Cheryl Chong (Co-founder, The Social Co. SG)
Kwok Jia Chuan (Co-founder, Conjunct Consulting)


Whether it’s through impact investing, social entrepreneurship or social ventures, many aspire to do well and do good. However, this is not as easy as it may seem. Finding meaning in business can be a complex endeavor and quite difficult to achieve in practice. How do innovation, entrepreneurship, sustainability, and social good fit together? Hear from a panel of stellar social good organizations, non-profits and startups who are innovating to solve some of society's most challenging problems.

This session is moderated by Mei Yi (General Manager, Asia, Peatix)
events.location: IDA Labs @ National Design Centre (#03-04, 111 Middle Road), , Singapore

events.name: Project Accelerator: SG Red Cross, raiSE, SG Children's Society, PM.Haze
events.description:
Our Project Accelerator will bring together experts with data science and analytical backgrounds to help non-profit organizations take the first steps to a successful data science project.   To ensure that our discussions are productive, we have to limit the number of people that can attend this event. Unfortunately, that means that not everyone who wishes to attend will be able to do so. Please do think about the RSVP questions and how you will be able to contribute to the discussions. Sign up if you’re ready to be an active participant! For this event, we will be featuring Singapore Red Cross, raiSE, Singapore Children's Society and People's Movement to Stop Haze (PM.Haze). Agenda  1 pm: Registration (NO food will be provided, so please have your lunch before) 1.15 pm: Introduction  1.20 pm: Overview by Featured Organizations 2 pm: Break-out for group discussions 4.30 pm: Reconvene to share learnings, and see how this can be brought forward Special thanks to Tableau for being our venue sponsor! How it works Each organization will have its own breakout group of interested volunteers and a facilitator to brainstorm and discuss ideas to help the organization get ready to embark on a data project.  Do note that there will NOT be any data or coding during the event. Singapore Red Cross The Singapore Red Cross, appointed the National Blood Donor Recruiter in 2001, aims to collect sufficient safe blood for the national transfusion needs.  Data: i) community blood-drives data, ii) community blood-drives booking calendar Objectives: i) To get insights on how to re-develop the database for community partners; ii) To integrate the new database with the existing workflow for the blood-drive booking calendar (or combine both)  


raiSE The Singapore Centre for Social Enterprise, raiSE was set up to raise awareness on social entrepreneurship and raise support for social enterprises in Singapore. Data: i) raiSE's membership database, ii) Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF) directory, iii) Singapore SilverPages (eldercare service), iv) SG enable (disability service), v) list of centres of specialization Objective: To get insights on creating a Knowledge Centre that provides information about the social services in Singapore.  


Singapore Children's Society Singapore Children's Society's Research and advocacy team inducts research to help identify social trends and issues related to children,youth and families in Singapore. Data: Child abuse study Objective: To get insights to promote understanding of issues related to children, youth and families 


People's Movement to Stop Haze (PM.Haze) PM.Haze aims to empower people with the knowledge, values and means to be drivers of global action to stop the haze and ultimately attain clean air for present and future generations. Data: i) Indonesia archived active fires (NASA), ii) LandSat, iii) maps demarcation, iv) Twitter/Facebook public posts on haze/fires Objective: To gather insights from historical fires such as incidence, speed of spread etc  


General discussion topics • What is your organization's goal? What does the world look like when you succeed? • What is the biggest problem you're facing? • What does your data look like (specific questions as needed)? • What types of questions can you answer with the data you have? • What problems do you have with your current data? • Where can you find or how can you better collect the data you need? • What do you think you can take away from this discussion, and what will be a good next step? 


RSVP question: When you RSVP, please let us know your full name and email address  If you are confirmed going, we will add you to slack, a communication tool where you can engage with the non-profit organizations before the event to learn more. So please make sure that your email address is correct. We look forward to having you at our Project Accelerator!
events.location: Tableau Singapore, South Beach Tower Level 10, 38 Beach Road

events.name: Conversations: A Very Serious Game
events.description:
A Very Serious Game 
Saturday, 24 September,2pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free admission. Register in the Lobby.

A visionary of his time, M.C. Escher saw the world differently. His works reflected a whimsical nature that delved into minute details, creating new perspectives that make us relook the world around us. Join us at Conversations: A Very Serious Game where we explore the game of art and mathematics and how Escher's practice resonates with artists, computer programmers and mathematicians today.  

Speakers include Federico Giudiceandrea , Curator of ‘Journey to Infinity: Escher’s World of Wonder’, Dr Sai Kit Yeung, Assistant Professor of Vision, Graphics and Computational Design (VGD) Group in SUTD, Angela Liong, co-founder and Artistic Director of ARTS FISSION, Richard Hassell, artist and founding director of WOHA Architects and Maria Kozhevnikov, Associate Professor of Psychology at NUS amongst others.

Line up:
2.00pm Introduction by Honor Harger, Executive Director, ArtScience Museum
2.10pm Dr Federico Giudiceandrea, Curator 
2.25pm Richard Hassell, Founding Director, WOHA 
2.45pm Q&A 
3.00pm Break 
3.10pm Dr Sai Kit Yeung, Assistant Professor, Vision, Graphics and Computational Design (VGD) Group, SUTD
3.30pm Angela Liong, Artistic Director, The Arts Fission Company
3.50pm Dr Maria Kozhevnikov, Associate Professor, NUS department of Psychology
4.10pm Q&A 
4.25pm End

events.name: 解密人生 - What is Numerology
events.description:
(Chinese) Understanding Numerology and how understanding it can relate to our daily environment and decisions什么是生命密码？  人生密码排列学（数字能量学）源自于2500年前, 西方古老神秘学，由希腊哲人兼数学家,也就是数学几何之父毕达哥拉斯(Pythagoras)所整合，发展出来的人类行为统计学。 透过科学研究，具有科学根据。毕达哥拉斯在探索生命奥秘的过程中，发现生命数字对人一生有极大的影响，通过生命密码排列，可以了解自己的天生潜力和性格特质。 了解人生密码可以帮助我们分析自己:并了解别人—性格、婚姻、健康、事业、家庭、流年运程
帮助自己:发掘长久以来一直被埋没的特长及潜在的天赋 , 开创更美好的人生 
幸福人生，从“数”开始！命运之轮，为你揭晓！命乃定数，运乃变数，掌握定数便能改变变数！破解生命密码，让您不再为健康问题而担忧！不再为难以预知的未来而迷惘！不再为建立和谐的家庭关系而惆怅！不再为更好的提高生活质量而废寝忘餐！ 来自新加坡资深的心灵密码导师，林倍弘老师为你倾情分享！让您的人生重新起航！ 
在西方，生命密码与塔罗、星座并列为三大神秘学，有着精准的预测性，与中国的易经有异曲同工之妙，是西方最主要的命理学。 
现今生命密码更是融汇了博大精深的《易经》和希腊数学家毕达哥拉斯的《数字理论》以及西方科技统计学的科学工具，通过一个人的阳历出生年月日绘出人生的密 码图，这个图表可以解开一个人的天生潜力和性格特质，经由身、心、灵的不同层面来了解自己和他人，指导人们选择适合自己的生活方式、职业、才能、发展。 

导师简介 (Trainer)林倍弘老师 (Miss Ummi Lin)• 英国国际企业家协会（合格数字科学分析师） • 马来西亚MyDNA （高级皮纹分析师）• 新加坡漳州总会 (交际康乐组副主任)• 新加坡龙溪会馆 (交际主任)• 新加坡宇芯数字科学学院院长• 新加坡益弘国际(执行董事)
林倍弘老师从 2007 年开始专研人生密码排列学（解密人生），多年来热心于公益服务，帮助无数人解读人生、排忧解难、指点迷津。其课程内容丰富、简单、易学、易懂，让您学以致用、预知未来，改变生命与健康。 
       一次学习，终身受用！ 

(Light Refreshments / Vegetarian Snacks will be provided)日期/Date:  24.09.2016时间/Time:  2:00-5:00pm 准时开始 (Please be on time. Event will start at 2pm)地点/Venue:  The Plaza, 7500A, Beach Road, #16-313,  Singapore 199591MRT: Nicoll Highway MRTBus: 961, 980, 100, 107
events.location: 199591, The Plaza 7500A Beach Road, #16-313 Singapore 199591, Singapore 199591

events.name: Singapore Shapeways Meetup - Featuring Arthur Ng (73ck)
events.description: Our semi-regular meetup series returns, this time we have lined up a session by Arthur (73ck) who will share some of his works sculpted in Sculptris! Arthur will also share on his workflow of getting his pieces from a 3d sculpt to colour sandstone printed figures using Shapeways! And of course, there will be the usual display and sharing of the various works and projects by ourselves and our partners too! This meeting is open to all so gon't miss out on it and we will see you all! =)
events.location: Funbie Studios, Liang Court, #B1-07, 177 River Valley Road, Singapore
